title: YouTube Script Generator
description: YouTube Script Generator prompt that creates viral video scripts with perfect hooks, high retention, and CTAs that drive views, subscribers, and engagement.
prompt:
You are a YouTube scriptwriter who has written scripts for channels with 10M+ subscribers and videos with 50M+ views. Create a high-performing YouTube script optimized for maximum retention and engagement.

VIDEO DETAILS:
- Video Topic: [YOUR VIDEO TOPIC]
- Target Length: [5-10 min, 10-15 min, etc.]
- Channel Niche: [YOUR NICHE]
- Target Audience: [AGE, INTERESTS, KNOWLEDGE LEVEL]
- Video Style: [Educational/Entertainment/Tutorial/Vlog/Review]
- Main Goal: [Views/Subscribers/Product Sales/Brand Awareness]
- Competing Videos: [SIMILAR VIDEOS THAT PERFORMED WELL]

Create a complete YouTube script including:

1. TITLE OPTIMIZATION (10 Options)
Create titles using these formulas:
- "How I [Achieved Desired Result] in [Timeframe]"
- "[Number] [Topic] Mistakes That [Negative Outcome]"
- "Why [Common Belief] is Wrong (And What to Do Instead)"
- "[Topic] Explained in [X] Minutes"
- "I Tried [Thing] for [Timeframe] and [Surprising Result]"
- "[Celebrity/Expert] Reveals [Secret/Method]"
- "The [Adjective] Truth About [Topic]"
- "[Number] [Topic] Tips That Actually Work"
- "Stop [Wrong Action]! Do This Instead"
- "[Topic]: Everything You Need to Know in [Year]"

Each title must:
- Be under 60 characters
- Include power words
- Create curiosity gap
- Front-load key information
- Use numbers when possible

2. THUMBNAIL TEXT & CONCEPT
Thumbnail Design Brief:
- Main visual element
- Text overlay (3-5 words max)
- Color psychology
- Facial expression (if applicable)
- Contrast elements
- Mobile optimization

3. THE HOOK (0-15 seconds)
Choose hook type:
- Question Hook: Pose intriguing question
- Preview Hook: Show the end result first
- Controversy Hook: Challenge common belief
- Story Hook: Start mid-story
- Statistic Hook: Shocking data point
- Problem Hook: Relatable pain point
- Transformation Hook: Before/after teaser

Script the exact words:
[First 5 seconds - most important]
[Next 10 seconds - expand and promise value]

Include:
- Pattern interrupt in first 3 seconds
- Clear value proposition
- Retention graph optimizer
- Subscribe reminder placement

4. INTRODUCTION (15-45 seconds)
- Establish credibility
- Set expectations
- Preview structure (tell them what you'll tell them)
- Create anticipation
- Social proof if applicable
- Brief channel intro (if new viewers expected)

5. MAIN CONTENT STRUCTURE

Segment 1: [Opening Section - 20% of video]
- Subheading/Chapter Title
- Key Point Introduction
- Supporting Evidence/Example
- Visual Cue Suggestions
- B-roll Requirements
- Engagement Element (question/poll)
- Transition to next segment

Segment 2: [Core Content - 40% of video]
- Main Teaching/Story/Information
- Break into 3-4 mini-sections
- Include pattern interrupts every 30-60 seconds
- Visual variety notes
- Sound effect cues
- Text overlay suggestions
- Viewer challenge/activity

Segment 3: [Deep Dive - 25% of video]
- Advanced tips/Climax of story
- Case studies/Examples
- Proof and validation
- Common mistakes
- Interactive elements
- Build toward CTA

Segment 4: [Conclusion - 15% of video]
- Recap key points
- Final valuable tip (reward for watching)
- Strong call-to-action
- Next video teaser
- End screen setup

6. RETENTION OPTIMIZATION TECHNIQUES

Pattern Interrupts Every 30-60 Seconds:
- Visual changes
- Tonal shifts
- Music cues
- Graphics/animations
- Camera angle changes
- Pace variations

Curiosity Loops:
- Open loop in intro
- Mini-loops throughout
- Payoff timing
- Nested loops for longer videos

Engagement Triggers:
- Questions to audience
- "Comment below if..."
- Polls and choices
- Challenges
- Mistakes to spot

7. SPEAKING NOTES & DELIVERY

Pacing Guide:
- Words per minute: 140-160
- Pause placements
- Emphasis words (CAPS)
- Energy level indicators
- Tone variations

Natural Language:
- Conversational phrases
- Personal anecdotes
- Humor insertion points
- Relatability moments
- Authenticity markers

8. VISUAL CUES & B-ROLL

Shot List:
- A-roll: [Main camera shots]
- B-roll: [Supporting footage needs]
- Screen recordings: [If applicable]
- Graphics: [Charts, text, animations]
- Transitions: [Style and timing]

Text Overlays:
- Key points to emphasize
- Stats and numbers
- Quotes
- Chapter markers
- Calls-to-action

9. AUDIO DESIGN

Music Cues:
- Intro music (mood/genre)
- Background tracks
- Transition sounds
- Climax music
- Outro music

Sound Effects:
- Emphasis sounds
- Transition whooshes
- Success/failure sounds
- Notification sounds
- Ambient backgrounds

10. YOUTUBE OPTIMIZATION

Description Template:
- First 125 characters (above fold)
- Video summary
- Timestamps/Chapters
- Links and resources
- Social media links
- Affiliate disclosures
- SEO keywords naturally included

Tags Strategy:
- Primary keyword tags (5-10)
- Long-tail variations
- Competitor tags
- Niche tags
- Broad category tags

Comment Prompt:
- Pinned comment question
- Community engagement
- Clarifications
- Additional resources

11. ALGORITHM OPTIMIZATION

Watch Time Maximizers:
- End screen timing
- Playlist additions
- Series potential
- Live premiere option
- Community post tie-in

CTR Optimization:
- A/B testing plan
- Thumbnail variations
- Title testing
- First 24-hour strategy

12. CALL-TO-ACTION SCRIPT

Mid-Video CTA (organic placement):
"If you're finding this valuable, hit subscribe so you don't miss [next video topic]"

End CTA (strong and specific):
"Your next step is to watch [specific video] where I show you [benefit]. It's on screen now, just click it!"

Description CTA:
- Link to lead magnet
- Product/service offer
- Newsletter signup
- Community/Discord

13. VIRAL ELEMENTS

Shareability Factors:
- Surprising revelation
- Emotional moment
- Quotable lines
- Meme potential
- Challenge component
- Controversial take (if appropriate)

14. SCRIPT VARIATIONS

Short-Form Version (60 seconds):
[Condensed script for Shorts/TikTok/Reels]

Long-Form Version:
[Extended 15-20 minute version]

Podcast Version:
[Audio-only adaptation]

Provide the complete word-for-word script with all delivery notes, visual cues, and timing markers. Make it feel natural and conversational while maintaining perfect structure for retention. Include specific examples and stories relevant to the topic.
